data.title: 9 Best Coaching Books: Exactly What To Read To Grow Your Business
data.meta_description: We're sharing our top picks for the best coaching books available on Amazon, plus why each book is a must-read for growing your coaching business.
data.meta_site_name: Websites for Coaches by Lovely Impact
data.text:
Lovely Impact’s Best Coaching Books Top Pick: The Prosperous Coach

We’ve chosen The Prosperous Coach by Steve Chandler and Rich Litvin as one of the best coaching books for two reasons. It has a step-by-step sales strategy for closing high-ticket coaching clients. This strategy has helped more than 75,000 coaches achieve true success!

Also, both Cass & Tee swear by the sales strategy in this book and have modified it to use with their clients to help them consistently close 6 figure coaching deals.

In this post, I’m going to share our top picks for the best coaching books. Plus, I’ll be sharing a brief description as to why we think each book is perfect for growing your coaching business.

If you are deciding which coaching books to buy, make sure to read the entire review! That way you can choose what works for your business. Let’s dive right in!

Disclaimer: Please note that this best coaching books post includes affiliate links that provide a commission to us if you decide to purchase. For more information, you can read our affiliate disclosure in our privacy policy.

9 Best Coaching Books

1. The Prosperous Coach by Steve Chandler and Rich Litvin

High-performing and high-paying clients don’t just happen. It’s a result of being a world-class coach! Become bold and audacious in your coaching business by implementing these transformational mindsets and strategies that have helped more than 75,000 others achieve true success.

As a coach, your success rides on your ability to reveal to your clients the things they cannot see for themselves. The Prosperous Coach: Increase Income and Impact for You and Your Clients will help you identify those hidden patterns, and communicate them to your clients with clarity and confidence.

2. Wellpreneur by Amanda Cook

If you’re a wellness coach struggling to hit your stride in the biz, Wellpreneur: The Ultimate Guide for Wellness Entrepreneurs to Nail Your Niche and Find Clients Online will give you the tips and tricks you need to win!

Social media alone simply won’t grow your coaching business. You need a system, and the systems outlined in this book will help you grow your business and book more of the right clients. Clients who will experience massive success and transformation by working closely with you.

This is a must read for wellness experts such as: health coaches, fitness instructors, yoga professionals and more!

3. Coaching Questions by Tony Stoltzfus

The right question, asked at the right time, can be a powerful catalyst for change and transformation. Learn how to get curious and ask questions that deepen your clients experience (and make you look like the pro you are). Coaching Questions: A Coach’s Guide to Powerful Asking Skills will teach you how and what to ask your clients, no matter your niche.

If you’ve always wanted to learn models for reframing conversations and positively challenging clients, it’s all here. Simply read and implement Tony Stoltzfus teachings and watch as you become a “Master of Asking”.

4. The Coaching Habit by Michael Bungay Stanier

By combining fundamental elements of coaching strategy with neuroscience and behavioural economics, The Coaching Habit: Say Less, Ask More & Change the Way You Lead Forever offers a one of a kind perspective into building coaching methodologies for your business that produce real, tangible results.

You’ll learn valuable insights that will save you valuable time (our most precious resource) and help your clients go further, faster. Learn how to maximize each coaching session with these tried and tested questions that will help you achieve the results you want.

5. Who The F*ck Am I To Be A Coach?! by Megan Jo Wilson

Welp! If the title doesn’t say it all! If you’ve ever doubted yourself. Stop. We get it! But – stop. Who The F*ck Am I To Be A Coach?!: A Warrior’s Guide to Building a Wildly Successful Coaching Business From the Inside Out will help you realize that wild, crazy success is within you! Screw limiting beliefs.

You can get out there and make an impact with your coaching biz, and do it in an authentic way! If you’re feeling stuck, or wondering why what you’re doing isn’t working, then read this book. It will help you look inside, face your limiting beliefs head on, and overcome them in a powerful way!

6. The Book of Coaching by Ajit Nawalkha

You are remarkable! Your passion for coaching is on 10! And so are your results. Your innate genius is powerful. In fact, the world needs MORE of it. The Book of Coaching for Extraordinary Coaches will help you take that genius to the next-level.

Grow your coaching business with specific strategies, techniques and methodologies that actually work. Here are the keys you need to unlock extraordinary coach status in your biz.

7. Make Money As A Life Coach by Sally Miller and Melissa Ricker

What if you had all you needed to begin creating your dream coaching business? Spoiler alert: you already do! Make Money As A Life Coach: How to Become a Life Coach and Attract Your First Paying Client will radically shift your perspective on being a life coach.

Learn how to grow your confidence and attract the clients you love to work with! This book will even help you get your first paying client in 30 days (or less). I know right? Check it out!

8. The Heart of Laser-Focused Coaching by Marion Franklin

These coaching strategies will help you get to the heart of your clients’ challenges, and learn to address them in a way that sparks change and transformation. No matter your level of coaching experience, The HeART of Laser-Focused Coaching: A Revolutionary Approach to Masterful Coaching has information you need to know in order to take your coaching interactions to a new level.

There’s even a rarely known principle in this book that honestly feels like a coaching cheat code. Nope! We’re not giving it away here. I guess you’ve just got to read this book for yourself. Check it out!

9. Helping People Change by Richard Boyatzis + Melvin L. Smith + Ellen Van Oosten

Positivity and inspiration is a powerful method for change. Helping People Change: Coaching with Compassion for Lifelong Learning and Growth will show you how problem-centered thinking, an approach often used by coaches in the industry, can actually inhibit your clients creativity.

If you’re wondering what great coaches are doing to help their clients dream bigger, jump higher and go further, then this is the book you need. Plus, they’ve woven powerful real-life stories into their teachings that will help open your eyes to a non-traditional way of approaching coaching – with compassion!

Best Coaching Books: Final Thoughts

I hope this helps you find the best coaching books for you! Let me know in the comments.

Do you plan on buying one of these books? Why or why not?

Which one on this list was your favorite?

And as always!! If you buy, please come back and let us know in the comments.
